snippet: Disney’s quarterly results reflected the shifting fortunes of its TV and movie businesses, as cable properties like ESPN took more of a back seat to consumer products.
abstract: Walt Disney Co reports fiscal third-quarter revenue of $13.1 billion, up 5 percent from year-earlier period; result nonetheless falls short of analyst expectations, sending shares down 6.4 percent in after-hours trading; Disney reports profit of $2.48 billion, up 11 percent from same period one year earlier.

byline.contributor: Emily Steel contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Disney’s quarterly results reflected the shifting fortunes of its TV and movie businesses, as cable properties like ESPN took more of a back seat to consumer products.

headline.main: Despite 5% Increase, Disney Revenue Disappoints Analysts
headline.print_headline: Despite 5% Increase, Disney Revenue Disappoints Analysts
